header_summary: The Bitcoin network is facing a spam attack caused by inscriptions, which requires action. A proposed solution involves adding a standardization option. Other discussions include unconfirmed inputs in coinjoin transactions, front-running in peer-to-peer marketplaces, and privacy concerns in the Lightning Network. Additionally, a new protocol for closing channels is introduced in a GitHub pull request.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions".
recent_posts.summary:
- Inscriptions in the Bitcoin network cause spam attacks by embedding themselves in witness.
- Taking action against inscriptions is necessary to prevent future spam attacks and show disapproval.
- Adding a standardization option could help address the complexity of rejecting inscriptions.

recent_posts.title: Denial of Service using Package Relay
recent_posts.summary:
- The acceptance of unconfirmed inputs in a coinjoin transaction raises safety concerns.
- The user recommends coordinating B not to accept unconfirmed UTXO with zero fees.
- Package relay and upcoming RBF proposals can enhance the security and efficiency of coinjoin transactions.

recent_posts.title: Civ Kit: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Market System
recent_posts.summary:
- Front- running in a peer-to-peer marketplace involves capitalizing on price influence before publishing offers.
- Concerns were raised about the architecture resembling a brokerage rather than an exchange market.
- The CivKit architecture aims to create a censorship-resistant global trading system while addressing front-running concerns.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy benefits for receiver's by encrypting specific routes.
- Routing payments through "regulated" nodes may limit potential routes and poses privacy risks.
- The discussion raises concerns about the trade- off between receiver privacy and decentralization.

recent_posts.title: Equalizing Packet Size
recent_posts.summary:
- Third- party eavesdroppers can infer payment routing by analyzing packet size in Lightning Network.
- Implementing fixed-size packets using BOLT8 tunnel encrypter objects can mitigate security risks.
- Buffering functionality and randomized timers can enhance privacy and robustness in packet transmission.

recent_posts.title: option_simple_close for "unfailable" closing
recent_posts.summary:
- The pull request introduces a new protocol for closing channels in the Lightning Network.
- It simplifies the closing process, removes older protocols, and adds new feature options.
- Detailed explanations of the new protocol, closing transaction structure, and feature options are provided.

active_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
active_posts.summary:
- The taproot annex is currently consensus valid but non- standard, and standardization discussions favor a Type-Length-Value (TLV) format.
- The proposal suggests allowing developers to use a non-structured taproot annex while agreeing on an exact format.
- Adopting this approach offers immediate utilization, future flexibility, and chainspace efficiency for taproot annex.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation discusses a blinded version of 2- of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- Party 1 is blind and should not learn the aggregate public key, aggregate signature, or message.
- The protocol involves key and nonce aggregation, and party 1 remains blinded throughout.

active_posts.title: On the experiment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives WG and marking this community process "up for grabs"
active_posts.summary:
- The failure of the CTV speedy trial and covenant proposals led to a new community process.
- Initiatives included the bitcoin- inquisition fork and archiving of covenant proposals.
- The author will focus on Lightning development, but encourages others to continue working on covenants.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email provides updates on channel jamming and details for the next call.
- The group plans to gather data on HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking for jamming mitigation.
- The email proposes a reputation scheme for forwarding HTLCs as the first step in mitigating channel jamming.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- The LNbits team discovered an exploit in handling invoices, which has been patched.
- Users are urged to update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to protect against the exploit.
- The incident highlights the need for developers to address potential exploits and vulnerabilities.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in New York City in late June.
- Attendees experimented with transcript- style notes, available at this link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MZhAH82YLEXWz4bTnSQcdTQ03FpH4JpukK9Pm7V02bk/edit?usp=sharing.
